lines.text: [Ranger J. Audobon Woodlore summons Humphrey and the other bears of Brownstone to his ranger station]
Now, the guests are here. Yes, they're here. Yes, indeed.
Now, there's been lots of advertising and there's a tourist for each and every one of you.
[the bears cheer again; then the ranger takes on a much sterner tone]
Oh, yes, last year, we've have one complaint of stealing.
We won't mention any names, will we?
[he looks at Humphrey, who smiles sheepishly]
But if it happens this year, your supreme penalty.
[he points to a bear rug; the bears all cringe at it]
I expect you to mix with the atmosphere and mix with the tourists, that's a must. Okay, mix it up, boys, mix it up.
[the bears all go out to greet the different tourists]
